intro: Fleischmannia capillipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Fleischmannia capillipes is well adapted to drought conditions, with features such as reduced leaf surface area and thick, water-storing tissues.
